entry.title: Ruby Tandoh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when baker Ruby Tandoh (pictured) publicly came out, she mocked critics who suggested that she had romanced a male contest judge?

entry.title: San Diego Trough Fault Zone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the San Diego Trough Fault Zone can produce an earthquake that devastates the counties of Los Angeles, Orange, and San Diego, California?

entry.title: Ravenshoe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ravenshoe has been noted for its passages dealing with the Charge of the Light Brigade, a failed military action during the Crimean War?

entry.title: Obsidian (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the software Obsidian was created by just two developers during the COVID-19 pandemic?

entry.title: Willi Ritschard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Willi Ritschard was not amused when he had to attend a royal banquet for Queen Elizabeth II on International Workers' Day?

entry.title: Vennture Brew Company (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that creating Vennture Brew Company involved 18 months of construction and $22,000 in crowdsourced funds?

entry.title: Philippine embassy in Damascus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that abused Overseas Filipino Workers accused the former chargé d'affaires of the Philippine embassy in Damascus of neglecting them while he was regularly partying with handsome Syrians?

entry.title: Stephen Gunzenhauser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that gas lighting inspired Stephen Gunzenhauser to start a classical music festival?
